column5: Got back from Camp Jiggy Jiggy to find my 'net connection out...  got it fixed today and WOW... very nice and fast for now anyway.  Last weekend Monique and I headed up for the opening weekend of partridge hunting, one of our most favorite weekends of the year.. we put a ton of km's on the bike and were pretty successful, bagging 9 birds in an afternoon and a half!  It was a blast, and for once the weather gods were very friendly.  It went down to below zero both nites, but we were warm with a fire.  Here's some pics and comments:  At Dads Outdoor Store in Temagami, we stopped in to see if they had any decent orange raingear, which they did.  Some really nice Helly Hanson gear at a VERY good price, (I have to wait till spring to get my Xtra Lard ass set,...) and we got to looking at this really nice youth model, double barrel .410....  well...  ealry xmas present I guess for Monique.  She fell in love with it!!  http://www.dadstemagami.ca  He had some really nice guns and some excellent prices by the way!  If your going up that way for moose stop in its an excellent store!  After Camp was set up, while i was getting ready to go, Monique walked up the trail and bagged this one not 100 yards from camp.. all by her lonesome!!!   I was grinning ear to ear when I heard the shot!!    What a day we had after that!!       Up to Sisseney lake and a leg stretch!    The one day was windless, what a nice quiet afternoon!    After all the partidge hunting was done, Monique decide on some topwater off the dock using our freinds at Hammerhead topwater lures, and after a bit of persistance she landed this beauty!!!      Of Course... I couldnt let that stand, and after only once cast I put her to shame with this massve Northern....    OK... OK.... maybe I held it a bit too close to the camera.... but hey the smaller ones are harder to catch... takes way more fishing finesse!!    Anyway we had a great weekend with no equipment breakdowns which was nice.  Heres till next time...  and the big hunt is coming SOON!!!
Orange ya glad for huntin' season?  Monique, keep catchin those nice fish, TJ will learn one day. Thanks for the report, Good luck on the BIG hunt.
Those are great words of inspiration right there  Great report TJ, looks like another amazing Jiggy Jiggy adventure.
Well ya sure can paint a purdy picture T.J! Two questions, why is one partridge a bright color? and second can you get those rainsuits in a bullseye pattern?
HEAD SHOTS   HEAD SHOTS.LOL Thanks for the report Boss.
Double barrel 410  OOOHHH  perfect shotgun for partridge.    Good shootin
Spruce grouse, all dark meat.  Very tasty.
Either yer a cradle robber or yer 36' tall.  JF
Great report TJ.  I imagine Monique will probably wup your arse at hunting the same as she does at fishing.  And so the cycle begins  Joey
Nothing says "Fall" like the sound of a flushing Ruffed Grouse! I like them with spaghetti & sauce..
awesome as always, looks like a good hunt, now bring on the big game, our deer archery season starts on saturday, i cant wait, hopefully it will be a good year.  nice to see ol sisney again.   jason
LOL...great report TJ.  Sure...the smaller ones are harder to land...but in this case her bass would have eaten that pike if it saw it....haha.
Nice clutch of birds there.  WTG.
Great outing TJ. Can't wait to bag a few grouse myself. And try not to hold those trouphy northerns vertically eh. lolol  -R-

Great report and pics TJ  Looks like you guys had perfect weather for hunting as you mentioned, went below zero at night.  Good job on those birds....they look very tasty in the plate Thanks for sharing Leechman

sure that is such a good idea...arming the wife like that???   , you better make sure to be good now.  nice report, nice birds too..that will make a nice meal for sure,looks like you got into a few more ruffed then the spruce up there.  wow those massive 3 footer rapalas work pretty good for those lunker pike,I thought they where just a novelty when they where selling them at Walmart last Christmas, but that's proof in the puddin right there
Monique....you looked simply smashing in the new duds....the gun is a very nice accessory lol  TJ...going to have that monster pike mounted??  hehehehehe
thanks for sharing another fun looking adventure!  Cheers!
Sure.... come though town and don't drop in AGAIN!!! See if the dang beer fairy drops in out the sky for you again.......  Nice pics... of Monique anyhow...

Thanks.... and its unlikely ill learn...    Spruce grouse... a bit meatyer... and wilder tasting.    Ya.. were very pleased with it!!   .... cradle robber...   Your help I need... lol....  hey  .. at least I'm a good teacher.   Sisseney is beautiful!!   So... her bass was blind... ah ha!!   If she was going to shoot me... it would have already happened!   I AM her accessory... lol   LOL.. when we are on our way up or back.. were usually on a mission!!!  and I LOVE the beer fairy.
Nice peice of heaven there.  Good shootin' !!!
